text: NGC 546 (also known as ESO 296-25, IRAS 01229-3819, MCG −6-4-29 and PGC 5255) is a transverse spiral galaxy about 299 million light years away from Earth and located in the constellation Sculptor. The largest diameter is 1.40 (122 thousand light years) and the smallest is 0.5 angular minutes (43 thousand light years). The first discovery was made by John Frederick William Herschel on 23 October 1835. ==References== Category:Spiral galaxies Category:Sculptor (constellation) Category:Galaxies discovered in 1835 0546
title: NGC 546
